instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of threat. If the comment is threatening output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: This comments system is broken...just gets more confusing. What's uncivil about this: "Kill the wildlife…then kill the messenger."

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of threat. If the comment is threatening output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: Agree...it always amazes me how some advocate for an income tax because a few thousand non-residents would pay, but ignore the simple fact that only a sales tax would capture the income of millions of tourists each year.   Just here in Ketchikan we have over a million cruise ship visitors each year.    All an income tax will do is drive the wealth out of this state and be yet another reason for people to not retire in Alaska.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of threat. If the comment is threatening output Yes, otherwise output No.
input:
So I've known and worked with Forest for a long time, he has spent most of his life in the woods.  Speculating on what happened in inappropriate and disrespectful.  

First off University employees regularly carry shotguns for bear protection.  You are totally wrong in your assumption.  

Second, on a multi day backpacking trip in the mountains the chance of running into a bear in a group of 12 is insanely low.  Carrying a shotgun would be so much more dangerous than any of the other alternatives.  The UAS ODS program has been tromping around Southeast Alaska for 15 odd years, and this is the first negative interaction with a bear, and no students got hurt.  This is a one in a million type event.  And I hope everyone joins me in wishing Forest a speedy recovery.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of threat. If the comment is threatening output Yes, otherwise output No.
input:
For once the court shows some common sense in an aircraft crash. Usually the big pockets, In this case Cessna and Continental are made to pay out money for the negligence of the operator.

Preston Cavner should have been charged with manslaughter for the death of his son and attempted manslaughter for the others injured in the crash. The fact he was never charged with this crime itself is an indictment of the criminal system.

There is no excuse for intentionally overloading an aircraft which is exactly what he did and got a four year old, his own son killed because of it. The burns from the crash the other victims suffered justify the attempted murder charge.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of threat. If the comment is threatening output Yes, otherwise output No.
input:
We are in agreement. But what does it matter if one is dealt with before the other, particularly since the campus policy effects thousands every day, staff, students, and visitors, while the capitol might see a few hundreds a year? The perfect is the enemy of the good, it is perfectly valid to remove restrictions one step at a time.

That is, after all, how we went from no legal carry in '93 to permitless in '04. One improvement at a time.
